intro: Isatis erzurumica, commonly known as Erzurum woad, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbage and mustard. The plant produces small, yellow flowers and has heart-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It is typically found in rocky or dry habitats and is adapted to thrive in temperate climates. Due to its historical use in dye production, it holds cultural significance in certain regions.
